titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: June D. MacArtor is a lawyer who has been very active in the area of environmental law. She received her law degree from Villanova University in 1974 after raising four children. She headed the Delaware Department of Justice Environmental Group for ten years, after which she became the head of the investigative group at the Division of Consumer Affairs. Later she was Deputy Director of the Division of Air and Waste Management in the Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control. She retired in 1990. MacArtor serves on the board of directors of the Delaware Nature Society and has also held positions at a number of other conservation, planning, and advisory committees and councils. She has taught courses in environmental law and policy at the University of Delaware and at Widener University.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of June D. MacArtor papers related to Ms. MacArtor's work on environmental issues for the State of Delaware and other citizens' watch groups. The collection includes reports and studies, minutes, handbooks, correspondence, legal forms, programs, notebooks, calendars, and memos.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of June D. MacArtor

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/macartor.htm.
